title: Development of Metacognitive Monitoring Strategies for Online Video Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Research on optimized video learning strategies in science for professionals, providing metacognitive monitoring training via video suitability assessments and pause-function utilization.

learning_goals: Learners can compare three types of video content and evaluate their suitability for knowledge acquisition with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can reduce cognitive load during video-based learning by 20% using metacognitive monitoring strategies.
Learners can improve comprehension accuracy of learning content by 15% through strategic use of the pause function.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
